page.title: 10CROFTING IN BONAR
page.content: There are lots of crofts in the vicinity of Bonar. A{croft}is a{small {farm,}and most of the people who own crofts have other jobs to go to. The land around Bonar is not all that fertile. There are no dairy farmers. The crofters often help each other and borrow each others' machinery. Most crofters grow hay, corn, tatties, swedes and turnips. Usually crofters have the essential equipment for crofting, tractor, plough, harrows, and a trailer. Most crofts have sheep, cows, hens and maybe some goats. Most of the cows are for beef. Crofters plant the tatties, turnips and swedes around April, but the corn goes in a bit earlier. The hay is usually cut around July/August and the tatties are usually picked around October.{
